messages.text:
*** Submitted as http://code.google.com/p/go/source/detail?r=06e3a4c30dfb ***

cgo: add -gccgopkgpath option to match gccgo -fgo-pkgpath

R=golang-dev, r, iant
CC=golang-dev
http://codereview.appspot.com/6416056

Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com,

I'd like you to review this change to
https://go.googlecode.com/hg/

LGTM but i wonder if a better approach might be a metaflag, so one could write

cgo -gccgo flag1,flag2=value,flag3

or something analogous. that way one could avoid flag proliferation.

On Fri, Jul 20, 2012 at 3:28 PM,  <r@golang.org> wrote:
> LGTM but i wonder if a better approach might be a metaflag, so one could
> write
>
> cgo -gccgo flag1,flag2=value,flag3
>
> or something analogous. that way one could avoid flag proliferation.

I think there will be a strictly limited number of flags that cgo has
to care about.  cgo needs to know about these flags, because they
affect the names of the symbols generated by gccgo.  cgo needs to know
those names in order to generate the right C code.

Ian
